content: herringbone cup sleeve written in us crochet terms this sleeve/cozy was customized to fit a dunkin cold drink cup large iced coffee cup bottom 32 oz = 2 5 diameter the medium iced coffee cup 24 oz = 2 5 diameter note you can customize the height of your sleeve by adding single_crochet row to the top of the sleeve or omitting single_crochet row for a shorter sleeve materials -worsted weight cotton 4 sugar & cream *thinner cotton yarns will not produce the same results note i love this cotton worked out pretty close -size h crochet hook -yarn needle stitches **- repeat repeat instructions between the * blo- back loop only chain- chain increase- increase 2 stitches in the same space single_crochet- single_crochet slip_stitch- slip_stitch st- stitch 3rd loop crochet- use the back of the stitch moogly has a great video to illustrate this technique https //www mooglyblog com/third-loop-half-double-crochet/ hhdc- herringbone half_double_crochet to make the hhdc stitch 1 yarn over insert hook into next stitch and pull up a loop 3 loops on hook 2 pull first loop straight through the second similar to a slip_stitch 3 yarn over pull through two remaining loops on hook interweave has a great illustration if you are new to this stitch https //www interweave com/article/crochet/crochet-herringbone-half-double-crochet-stitch/ note beginning chain does not count as a stitch 1st st of each round starts in the same st as the chain **end each round by slip_stitch into the first stitch of the round ** corinna s corner custom crochet you may sell finished items please link to pattern listing pattern is property of corinna varilek may not be sold or distributed ©2022 herringbone cup sleeve written in us crochet terms large sleeve- construction of bottom of cup sleeve r1 make a magic_ring ch1 single_crochet 6 slip_stitch to join 6 tip if you do not know how to make a magic_ring you can chain 3 and work your stitches in the first chain omit the chain 1 start and make 6 single_crochet into the first chain slip_stitch to join r2 chain 1 single_crochet increase each st around slip_stitch to join 12 r3 chain 1 half_double_crochet increase same st as chain half_double_crochet next *half_double_crochet increase next half_double_crochet next* slip_stitch to join 18 r4 chain 1 half_double_crochet increase same st as chain half_double_crochet next 2 *half_double_crochet increase next half_double_crochet next 2* slip_stitch to join 24 r7 chain 1 single_crochet same st as chain single_crochet around slip_stitch to join 24 r5 chain 1 single_crochet blo same st as chain single_crochet blo around slip_stitch to join 24 note this creates the disc portion of your cup allowing you to have a nice clean edge where it folds and starts the sides 15 measure the diameter of your sleeve should be at 2 ¾ possibly 2 you can also sit your cup on 16 top and you should see the edges of that last round fit just beyond the edge of your cup like a coaster if not at this point adjust
